spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Channel Mode/Speed - Controls the speed, phy type, and fec options of a channel. (Not all modes are valid in all channels)
6'd00 : Disabled (Channel is shut down and held in reset)
6'd01 - 14: Reserved
6'd15 : 10GBASE-R
6'd16 : 10GBASE-R + FCFEC
6'd17 - 20: Reserved
6'd21 : 25GBASE-R1
6'd22 : 25GBASE-R1 + FCFEC
6'd23 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC
6'd24 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC r1.5
6'd25 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC r1.6
6'd26 : 40GBASE-R4
6'd27 : 40GBASE-R4 + FCFEC
6'd28 - 36: Reserved
6'd37 : 50GBASE-R2
6'd38 : 50GBASE-R2 + FCFEC
6'd39 : 50GBASE-R2 + RSFEC
6'd40 - 42: Reserved
6'd43 : 50GBASE-R1 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd44 - 45: Reserved
6'd46 : 100GBASE-R4
6'd47 : 100GBASE-R4 + RSFEC
6'd48 - 49: Reserved
6'd50 : 100GBASE-R2 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd51 : 100GBASE-R1 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd52 : 200GBASE-R8 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd53 : 200GBASE-R4 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd54 : 200GBASE-R2 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd55 : Reserved
6'd56 : 400GBASE-R8 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd57 : 400GBASE-R4 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd58 - 6'd63 : Reserved""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txswrst
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 TX Reset Active
1'b0 TX Normal Operation""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxswrst
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 RX Reset Active
1'b0 RX Normal Operation""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 TX Normal Operation
1'b0 TX Channel Disabled""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txdrain
spirit:field.spirit:description: Setting this bit causes transmit path to enter into Drain mode where all the data from the TXFIFO is drained out.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 RX Normal Operation
1'b0 RX Channel Disabled""

spirit:field.spirit:name: gmiilpbk
spirit:field.spirit:description: Setting this bit enables the Loopback on the MAC-PCS Interface for this Channel. The Transmit data and controls are looped back on to the receive MAC module for this Channel. When this loopback is enabled, the data received from the PCS for this channel is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txjabber
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the outgoing (Transmit) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current outgoing frame on this Channel exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point with EOF-ERROR. This will limit the frame transmission run-off in case of Application logic error.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxjabber
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the incoming (Receive) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current incoming frame on this Channel equals or exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point. The Frame Status is updated with a Jabber Error and the rest of the Jabbered frame that is being received is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: disfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the Transmit FCS Insertion""

spirit:field.spirit:name: invfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Forces the inserted Transmit FCS to an inverted value to force an error in all conditions""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ignfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Ignore the FCS on received frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: stripfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Strips the FCS of received frames before they are forwarded to the application""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifglen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the minimum IFG length in bytes inserted on transmit frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifgpacing
spirit:field.spirit:description: IFG controls (reserved)""

The Transmit data and controls are looped back on to the receive MAC module for this Channel. When this loopback is enabled, the data received from the PCS for this channel is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txjabber
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the outgoing (Transmit) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current outgoing frame on this Channel exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point with EOF-ERROR. This will limit the frame transmission run-off in case of Application logic error.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxjabber
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the incoming (Receive) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current incoming frame on this Channel equals or exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point. The Frame Status is updated with a Jabber Error and the rest of the Jabbered frame that is being received is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: disfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the Transmit FCS Insertion""

spirit:field.spirit:name: invfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Forces the inserted Transmit FCS to an inverted value to force an error in all conditions""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ignfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Ignore the FCS on received frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: stripfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Strips the FCS of received frames before they are forwarded to the application""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifglen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the minimum IFG length in bytes inserted on transmit frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifgpacing
spirit:field.spirit:description: IFG controls (reserved)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Channel Mode/Speed - Controls the speed, phy type, and fec options of a channel. (Not all modes are valid in all channels)
6'd00 : Disabled (Channel is shut down and held in reset)
6'd01 - 14: Reserved
6'd15 : 10GBASE-R
6'd16 : 10GBASE-R + FCFEC
6'd17 - 20: Reserved
6'd21 : 25GBASE-R1
6'd22 : 25GBASE-R1 + FCFEC
6'd23 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC
6'd24 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC r1.5
6'd25 : 25GBASE-R1 + RSFEC r1.6
6'd26 : 40GBASE-R4
6'd27 : 40GBASE-R4 + FCFEC
6'd28 - 36: Reserved
6'd37 : 50GBASE-R2
6'd38 : 50GBASE-R2 + FCFEC
6'd39 : 50GBASE-R2 + RSFEC
6'd40 - 42: Reserved
6'd43 : 50GBASE-R1 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd44 - 45: Reserved
6'd46 : 100GBASE-R4
6'd47 : 100GBASE-R4 + RSFEC
6'd48 - 49: Reserved
6'd50 : 100GBASE-R2 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd51 : 100GBASE-R1 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd52 : 200GBASE-R8 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd53 : 200GBASE-R4 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd54 : 200GBASE-R2 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd55 : Reserved
6'd56 : 400GBASE-R8 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd57 : 400GBASE-R4 + RSFEC (KP)
6'd58 - 6'd63 : Reserved""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txswrst
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 TX Reset Active
1'b0 TX Normal Operation""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxswrst
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 RX Reset Active
1'b0 RX Normal Operation""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 TX Normal Operation
1'b0 TX Channel Disabled""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txdrain
spirit:field.spirit:description: Setting this bit causes transmit path to enter into Drain mode where all the data from the TXFIFO is drained out.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
1'b1 RX Normal Operation
1'b0 RX Channel Disabled""

spirit:field.spirit:name: gmiilpbk
spirit:field.spirit:description: Setting this bit enables the Loopback on the MAC-PCS Interface for this Channel. The Transmit data and controls are looped back on to the receive MAC module for this Channel. When this loopback is enabled, the data received from the PCS for this channel is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txjabber
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the outgoing (Transmit) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current outgoing frame on this Channel exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point with EOF-ERROR. This will limit the frame transmission run-off in case of Application logic error.""

spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines the Jabber Size for the incoming (Receive) frames on this Channel. When the length of the current incoming frame on this Channel equals or exceeds the value programmed in this field, the Frame is considered a Jabber Frame and is truncated at that point. The Frame Status is updated with a Jabber Error and the rest of the Jabbered frame that is being received is ignored.""

spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the Transmit FCS Insertion""

spirit:field.spirit:name: invfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Forces the inserted Transmit FCS to an inverted value to force an error in all conditions""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ignfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Ignore the FCS on received frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: stripfcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Strips the FCS of received frames before they are forwarded to the application""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifglen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects the minimum IFG length in bytes inserted on transmit frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifgpacing
spirit:field.spirit:description: IFG controls (reserved)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: disfcsonerr
spirit:field.spirit:description: When Disable FCS is set, this will include errored frames""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable Pause frame generation from XOFF pins""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, the UMAC Core is enabled for Flow-Control decode operation for this Channel and it will decode all the incoming frames for PAUSE Control Frames as specified in the IEEE 802.3 Specification.
When reset, this Channel does not decode the frames for PAUSE Control Frames.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxpfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, the UMAC Core is enabled for Priority Flow-Control decode operation for this Channel.
If the UMAC Core receives a valid Priority PAUSE Control Frame, it will load the timers and provide the XOFF indication to the Application logic (ff_rxch0pfcxoff[7:0]) based on the Time Vector fields in the 8 priorities.
When reset, this Channel does not decode the frames for Priority PAUSE Control Frames.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfctotx
spirit:field.spirit:description: If decoding of Flow-Control frames is enabled, setting this bit will disable the transmission of user data frames for the time given in the PAUSE_TIME field of the PAUSE Control Frame when UMAC Core receives a valid PAUSE Control Frame.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfilterfc
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When this bit is set, the UMAC will filter out the Pause frames from being sent to the Application Logic.
When this bit is reset, the UMAC does not filter out the Pause frames .
This bit has no effect on actual processing/decoding on the PAUSEControl frames, which is controlled using the Enable Receive Flow Control Decode register bit.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfilterpfc
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When this bit is set, the UMAC will filter out the Priority Pause frames from being sent to the Application Logic.
When this bit is reset, the UMAC does not filter out the Priority Pause frames
This bit has no effect on actual processing/decoding on the Priority PAUSE Control frames, which is controlled using the Enable Priority Receive Flow Control Decode register bit.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txpadrunt
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX PAD length (set to 0 to disable)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txwrthresh
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX fifo write threshold. Set to 255-(delay between afull and vld)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txrdthresh
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX fifo read threshold""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txlfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits local faults. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txrfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits remote faults. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txidle
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits idles. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxpadrunt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Defines the MinFrame Size for padding in the Receive direction""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxlfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives L_FAULT ordered set.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxrfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives R_FAULT ordered set.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxidle
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives IDLE Pattern.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: statsclr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to clear stats for mac channel""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txignorerx
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrides the FAULT state recieved from the rx Reconciliation Layer""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txpfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable PFC frame generation from XOFF pins (Mask per pin)""

spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable Pause frame generation from XOFF pins""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, the UMAC Core is enabled for Flow-Control decode operation for this Channel and it will decode all the incoming frames for PAUSE Control Frames as specified in the IEEE 802.3 Specification.
When reset, this Channel does not decode the frames for PAUSE Control Frames.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxpfcen
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, the UMAC Core is enabled for Priority Flow-Control decode operation for this Channel.
If the UMAC Core receives a valid Priority PAUSE Control Frame, it will load the timers and provide the XOFF indication to the Application logic (ff_rxch0pfcxoff[7:0]) based on the Time Vector fields in the 8 priorities.
When reset, this Channel does not decode the frames for Priority PAUSE Control Frames.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfctotx
spirit:field.spirit:description: If decoding of Flow-Control frames is enabled, setting this bit will disable the transmission of user data frames for the time given in the PAUSE_TIME field of the PAUSE Control Frame when UMAC Core receives a valid PAUSE Control Frame.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfilterfc
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When this bit is set, the UMAC will filter out the Pause frames from being sent to the Application Logic.
When this bit is reset, the UMAC does not filter out the Pause frames .
This bit has no effect on actual processing/decoding on the PAUSEControl frames, which is controlled using the Enable Receive Flow Control Decode register bit.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxfilterpfc
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When this bit is set, the UMAC will filter out the Priority Pause frames from being sent to the Application Logic.
When this bit is reset, the UMAC does not filter out the Priority Pause frames
This bit has no effect on actual processing/decoding on the Priority PAUSE Control frames, which is controlled using the Enable Priority Receive Flow Control Decode register bit.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txpadrunt
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX PAD length (set to 0 to disable)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txwrthresh
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX fifo write threshold. Set to 255-(delay between afull and vld)""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txrdthresh
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX fifo read threshold""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txlfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits local faults. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txrfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits remote faults. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: txidle
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously transmits idles. Normal traffic is overriden and not paused""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxpadrunt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Defines the MinFrame Size for padding in the Receive direction""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxlfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives L_FAULT ordered set.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxrfault
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives R_FAULT ordered set.""

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxidle
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, the MAC continuously receives IDLE Pattern.""

Controls Serdes Ready Pacer Select
1'b0: Normal
1'b1: Pacer Enabled""

spirit:field.spirit:name: pacerdiv
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Serdes ready pacer divide scaling value determined by: (((Channel_Rate * Overhead_Ratio) / #Serdes_Per_Channel) / (Core_Clock_Frequency * Serdes_Width)) * 2^16
Overhead_Ratio = 10/8 (1G and below), 68/64 (Modes with KP FEC), 66/64 (All other modes)
Example for 100GR4: (((100*10^9 * 66/64) / 4) / (825*10^6 * 40)) * 2^16 = 51200
Note: All serdes pacer divide scaling value registers associated with a channel must be set to the same value with the corresponding pacer enable bits set to 1'b1 when in use""

spirit:field.spirit:name: pacerdiv
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Serdes ready pacer divide scaling value determined by: (((Channel_Rate * Overhead_Ratio) / #Serdes_Per_Channel) / (Core_Clock_Frequency * Serdes_Width)) * 2^16
Overhead_Ratio = 10/8 (1G and below), 68/64 (Modes with KP FEC), 66/64 (All other modes)
Example for 100GR4: (((100*10^9 * 66/64) / 4) / (825*10^6 * 40)) * 2^16 = 51200
Note: All serdes pacer divide scaling value registers associated with a channel must be set to the same value with the corresponding pacer enable bits set to 1'b1 when in use""
